strings: <se_low>King Trode: What an utterly incredible sight, a manmade construction all the way up here!

<se_high>Jessica: Just think.
Without the power to fly, we never would've been able to find this place.
<se_high>Jessica: So how did the person who built this pull it off? Almost makes you wonder if it was created by birds!
<se_low>Yangus: Yahooooooooo!
<se_low>Yangus: Aah, wot is it about people that makes 'em wanna shout out loud when they come to a place like this!?
<se_def>Angelo: You'd think that whoever made the effort to build this all the way up here would've carved their name on it for posterity.<page>Angelo: Maybe they died before they had the chance.

<se_def>Angelo: What a waste not to get any recognition.
I certainly know how that feels.

<se_low>King Trode: That altar is a truly incredible sight!
Who'd have thought there'd be a manmade construction all the way up here!?

<se_high>Jessica: Just think.
Without the power to fly, we never would've been able to find this place.
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder if there are other places like this out there?
<se_low>Yangus: Yahooooooooo!
<se_low>Yangus: Aah, wot is it about people that makes 'em wanna shout out loud when they come to a place like this!?
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder if the person who went to all the trouble to build that altar died before they had the chance to leave their name on it?

<se_def>Angelo: What a waste not to get any recognition.
I certainly know how that feels.
<se_low>King Trode: It appears that you can access that strange cave from the altar, but I can't possibly take the Princess to such a dangerous place.
<se_low>King Trode: If you must insist on going inside, I'll have to stay here with Medea.

<se_low>King Trode: Why ever would anyone build an altar in a place like this!?
It really is a mystery.

<se_low>King Trode: That altar is a truly incredible sight!
Who'd have thought there'd be a manmade construction all the way up here!?
<se_low>Yangus: I reckon it must be a pretty weird cave startin' out in a place like this, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Looks pretty deep to me, an' all. If we're goin' in, we'd better mind 'ow we go.
<se_low>Yangus: What we doin' out 'ere in the middle of nowhere when we're s'posed to be fightin' that fat geezer Rhapthorne?
<se_low>Yangus: I ain't got a clue wot yer thinkin' comin' 'ere, guv.
<se_low>Yangus: Yahooooooooo!
<se_low>Yangus: Aah, wot is it about people that makes 'em wanna shout out loud when they come to a place like this!?
<se_high>Jessica: I thought we'd already seen everything during our travels, but it looks like we missed a few places!

<se_high>Jessica: It's like a new frontier!
And now that we've made it this far, we can't possibly go back until we've explored it all.

<se_high>Jessica: This is so exciting!
We're taking a step into a whole new world!

<se_high>Jessica: Hey, look!
There's some kind of emblem carved on the surface of the altar.
<se_high>Jessica: In that dream I had, the emblem started glowing and flew into the sky.

<se_high>Jessica: Just think.
Without the power to fly, we never would've been able to find this place.
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder if there are other places like this out there?
<se_def>Angelo: Looks like that dream we all had was a kind of premonition of this place.

<se_def>Angelo: But what's so special about this place that we'd all share the same dream about it?
The plot thickens...

<se_def>Angelo: ...I recognise this place!
I had a dream about it not long ago!

<se_low>Yangus: You wot!?
I 'ad the same dream meself!
<se_low>King Trode: How extraordinary! I was just thinking to myself how strange it was to come upon the same altar I dreamt about the other day...
<se_high>Red: Wait, I 'ad that dream an' all. ...Urgh, I feel all icky now.
<se_low>Morrie: Che!? I am not the only one who had this dream?
<se_high>Jessica: No, I had it, too. It looks like all of us had exactly the same dream. But what does it mean?

<se_low>Yangus: Yikes! I don't get it!
An' I don't like it neither!
This kinda thing really gives me the willies!
<se_def>Angelo: Who in their right mind would build an altar all the way out here?
<se_def>Angelo: Mind you, we're none too bright coming here ourselves. Fools rush in where angels fear to tread, and all that.
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder if the person who went to all the trouble to build that altar died before they had the chance to leave their name on it?

<se_def>Angelo: What a waste not to get any recognition.
I certainly know how that feels.

<se_low>King Trode: Good grief!
So there's a strange race of people called the Dragovians living beyond the altar!?

<se_low>King Trode: ...Hm. Then I was certainly correct in thinking the Princess and I shouldn't join you.
You go on ahead without us.
<se_low>Yangus: Fight Rhapthorne or save the Lord of the Dragovians... Save the Lord of the Dragovians or fight Rhapthorne...<page>Yangus: I can't figure out which to do first!
<se_high>Jessica: Actually, I'm still recovering from the shock of finding out that the Dragovians even exist.
<se_high>Jessica: In fact, we've seen so many incredible things, I can't figure out which one to be most surprised about!
<se_def>Angelo: No doubt this altar was built by the Lord of the Dragovians to conceal and protect his domain from the outside world.
<se_def>Angelo: And, for some reason, we came upon the emblem that's always remained hidden up to now, and found our way in.

<se_low>King Trode: Good heavens, <hero>!
You have the blood of the Argonian royal family in your veins!?
<se_low>King Trode: ...Then, if things had been different, Medea would have been promised to you in marriage...

<se_low>King Trode: Not that we can do anything about that now.
It's far too late.
How cruel Fate can be at times...
<se_low>King Trode: Nay, how utterly sadistic!

<se_low>Yangus: We've seen a lot of weird an' wonderful things on our travels so far, eh?
But this place really takes the biscuit!
<se_low>Yangus: Who'd 'ave thought you'd find out about yer parents 'ere an' all, guv!?
<se_high>Jessica: Now that we've saved the Dragovians, we can focus all of our efforts on defeating Rhapthorne.

<se_high>Jessica: This is it!
The big battle!
Time to find him and show him who's boss!
<se_def>Angelo: I suspect your Dragovian blood led us here, <hero>.
<se_def>Angelo: It was beckoning you to return to your birthplace and save your people...

<se_def>Angelo: I could be wrong.
Who knows whether it's true or not?
<se_high>Red: It's pretty 'igh up 'ere, innit? A long way to lug up an 'eavy stone altar, that's for sure.

<se_high>Red: There's no way that whoppin' great thing was ever carried up 'ere. Maybe whoever made it could fly. There's a thought, eh?
Heh heh. The plot thickens!
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe I should bring the Monster Arena to the top of the mountain like this, ay? One wronged move, and you are flong down to the valley below!
<se_low>Morrie: Si! Imagine the THRILL! Imagine the sense of GUSTO and PASSION it makes, ay!
<se_high>Red: It's a bit weird 'avin' an altar like this so 'igh up, innit?
<se_high>Red: An' I didn't see no road comin' up 'ere, did you? Maybe whoever plonked it down 'ere came the same way we did, eh? By air.
<se_low>Morrie: To have the Monster Arena on top of a mountain like this... FANTASTICO! One wronged move, and you are flong down to the valley below!
<se_low>Morrie: Si! Imagine the THRILL! Imagine the sense of GUSTO and PASSION it makes, ay!
<se_high>Red: Blimey, it's another 'ole new world spread out before yer eyes, ain't it?
<se_high>Red: Well, anywhere's better than that grey 'ole we was in before, eh?
<se_high>Red: Somefin' botherin' you about this altar an' all, <hero>? I know wot ya mean...
<se_high>Red: It's a bit weird 'avin' an altar like this so 'igh up, innit?
<se_high>Red: An' I didn't see no road comin' up 'ere, did you? Maybe whoever plonked it down 'ere came the same way we did, eh? By air.
<se_low>Morrie: We take the first steps into a new world again, ay, ragazzo?
<se_low>Morrie: I wait with the bad breath to see what is in the store for us!
<se_low>Morrie: There is a reason for everything people make, ay? Like the clothes. They are for keeping us warm and making us look FANTASTICO, si?
<se_low>Morrie: Allora, there must be some reason why this altar was builded.
<se_low>Morrie: To have the Monster Arena on top of a mountain like this... FANTASTICO! One wronged move, and you are flong down to the valley below!
<se_low>Morrie: Si! Imagine the THRILL! Imagine the sense of GUSTO and PASSION it makes, ay!
<se_high>Red: Never a dull moment wiv you, is it, <hero>? Somefin' always comes up just when we're s'posed to be savin' the world from Rhapthorne's clutches.
<se_high>Red: Sometimes I wonder why any of us stick wiv ya. We must be bonkers.
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe this emblem is appearing here because of the Lord of the Dragovians losing his marble, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: I don't know if the dream we all have about this was just the coincidenza or not...
<se_high>Red: Truth is, I ain't never been much of a believer in fate an' all that.
<se_high>Red: But it's pretty 'ard to believe all this 'as just been down to chance, eh? Us lot all meetin' and comin' 'ere together to take on the Dragovian Lord, I mean.
<se_high>Red: So I'm startin' to think maybe fate an' destiny ain't as stupid as I thought they was. ...Thanks to you, <hero>.
<se_low>Morrie: This little avventura has given me the answers to many of the mystery about you, ragazzo.
<se_low>Morrie: I thank you from my bottom that I can accompany you together, ay?

<se_low>Morrie: Allora! We have solved one problem.
Now we go on to the next!
